Class Period

java.lang.Object
Period
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, TimePeriod
public class Period
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, TimePeriod
Represents the course registration Period of the University. Admin can access the system regardless of the registration period. Student can only access the system within the registration period.
See Also:
Serialized Form

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Period()
    Creates a default registration Period.

  • Constructor Details

    • Period

      public Period()
      Creates a default registration Period.

      Default start period: 1st December 2020, 12AM

      Default end period: 31st December 2020, 12AM

      public void setPeriod​(java.util.Date startPeriod, java.util.Date endPeriod)
      Method that changes the start time and end time of the registration Period.
      Parameters:
      startPeriod - The new start time Date object of the calling Period object.
      endPeriod - The new end time Date object of the calling Period object.

    • validatePeriod

      public boolean validatePeriod()
      Method that validates the current time with the registration Period.
      Returns:
      True if current time is within the registration Period, else return false.
